page.title: 05The City of London
page.content: Much of the City of London was estroyed in the War, necessitating immense rebuilding. The Nat. West. International Tower is the tallest building in London and dwarfs St.Pauls. The Barbican Estate, enclosing the Museum of London, the Arts Centre and numerous luxury apartments has been built on the site of Cripplegate and is a popular area for Londoners and tourists. There is still much evidence of historic London. St. Dunstan's in the East near Idol Lane, the Bevis Marks Synagogue in Camomile Street and names such as Crutched Friars and Pepys Street are a few examples. There are also constant excavations, such as the current ones by the old Royal Mint off East Smithfield and near Portsoken Street, (E1).
